uxbiases.desc: If you have both general information and specific information, you tend to focus on the specific. The fallacy is committed when a person judges that an outcome will occur based on the specifics, ignoring the general probability that a thing is true.
uxbiases.exam: About 8% of all men are colorblind, but in your user research, testing an interface with a 3:1 color contrast ratio, 99/100 users report no problem. You would then assume that that less that only one percent of users have an issue - when, in fact, 8% will.

uxbiases.desc: Belief Bias is when one's evaluation of the logical strength of an argument is biased by their belief in the truth or falsity of the conclusion.
uxbiases.exam: "What we need is a simple user interface, not options for our users," says Jessica from marketing, who has no data to support this conclusion.

uxbiases.desc: Cognitive Dissonance is the mental stress or discomfort experienced by an individual who holds two or more contradictory beliefs, ideas, or values at the same time; performs an action that is contradictory to their beliefs, ideas, or values; or is confronted by new information that conflicts with existing beliefs, ideas or values.
